input_text:
Job Title: Material Coordinator

Location: Edwards, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Purchasing, Supply Chain

Description:
Goldbelt Integrated Logistics Services (GbILS) provides four specific areas of expertise—Logistics Engineering, Measurement Sciences, Program Management, and Technical Support—serving the scientific, technical, and engineering needs of clients. GbILS values its innovative thinking and service-oriented team who provide services for a variety of federal government and commercial clients.

Summary:

The Material Coordinator will provide services and support to the NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center contract located at Edwards AFB, California. The Material Coordinator will perform duties primarily associated with SCA Labor Category Material Coordinator from the SCA Directory of Occupations 5 th edition .

Responsibilities

Essential Job Functions:

 Be assigned to one or more work areas to support contract Logistics Services consisting of: Supply and Materials Management  Equipment Management  Property Disposal  Transportation Management (including shipping and fleet management)  Mail Management  Perform duties found within the Performance Work Statement (PWS) Section 5, Equipment Management, Section 6, Property Disposal Management, and may support section 8, Mail Management in accordance with NASA Instructions and Technical Directives  Provide logistics support for the identification, control, and accountability of equipment acquired by NASA in accordance with NASA policy.  Assist with Property Disposal Management and Reutilization of Excess and Surplus Property  May provide mail services (i.e., receipt, storage, and distribution) for the AFRC community to include United States Postal Service (USPS) mail, express/certified/registered/priority and small packages, AFRC internal mail, and pouch mail.  If trained and required to support mail duties, will be required to obtain and retain a Secret clearance.  Be familiar with NASA publications, forms, and regulations listed in the PWS and how all work activities are performed in accordance with those references.  Utilize NASA provided computer equipment and software/databases to perform required job duties  Provide a continuous audit trail of an item from its initial receipt by NASA until acceptance in DISPOSAL System in accordance with NPR 4200.1. Equipment Management Procedural Requirements  Perform inventory services for materials and property to include issuing, handling, storing, and maintaining accountability of property and ensure timely correction of discrepancies  Develop methods and improve procedures for storying property, plan use of storage facilities, and assist in the performance of Administrative and Industrial Customer Support and Equipment Control requirements  Expedite the flow of material, parts, and property in accordance with NASA priorities  Review supply and equipment requests for accuracy and assist in resolving all discrepancies  Using a computer, work to ensure any accountable items have been cataloged properly  Assist in the maintenance of accountability records in systems of record  Create new catalog records using data provided  Assist in the performance of equipment account inventories as required  Process transfers and other transactions with supporting documentation  Process corrections/adjustments to equipment accounts, attaching the documents in the transaction records  Assist in the performance of Material Handling requirements  Sign for property received and ensure accountable property is cataloged according to NASA procedures  Assist in processing item turn-ins including processing turn-in transactions  Prepare property for shipment, arrange inspection from representatives, and move property to specified areas  Assist in the delivery of property received to the correct work center, or customer, and obtain signed receipt documentation  Assist in the performance of office moves / movement of furniture and equipment  Assist with documentation and accountability over all vehicles assigned  Understand and work towards all timeliness and quality standards found in the Performance Requirements Summary for work area assigned  Compile report of quantity and type of work accomplished  Move or transport material from one department to another, using hand or industrial truck  May compile perpetual production records in order to locate material using manual or computerized system  Direct materiel management activities involved in developing, operating, implementing, and analyzing manual and automated integrated logistics systems  May be tasked, trained, and perform duties as a non-CDL Truck Driver or Material Handling Equipment operator, including operating: Medium Trucks, Forklifts, and Specialty Material Handling Equipment 

Qualifications

Necessary Skills and Knowledge:

 Ability to safely lift to 50 lbs.  Must be able to pass NASA forklift training and certification and pass NASA physical to receive forklift license.  Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and via email  Ability to perform the physical requirements of the position including being on your feet most of the day and lifting requirements.  Ability to be trained in the use of warehouse tools and manual material handling equipment. 

Minimum Qualifications:

 Ability to obtain and retain a Common Access Card (CAC).  Must be able to clearly read, write, speak, and comprehend the English language.  Ability to pass a background check including a clean driving record.  Pass pre-employment drug screening. 

Preferred Qualifications:

 Previous experience in using computers as part of a military or civilian retail / store / warehouse environment.  Previous experience working in a warehouse or other industrial environment and/or experience with driving trucks and/or other non-CDL required vehicles.  High school diploma or equivalent 

The salary for this position is $28.50 per hour.

Pay And Benefits

At Goldbelt, we value and reward our team's dedication and hard work. We provide a competitive base salary commensurate with your qualifications and experience. As an employee, you'll enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company matching, tax-deferred savings options, supplementary benefits, paid time off, and professional development opportunities.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Material Coordinator
output_json.summary: Goldbelt Integrated Logistics Services (GbILS) provides four specific areas of expertise—Logistics Engineering, Measurement Sciences, Program Management, and Technical Support—serving the scientific, technical, and engineering needs of clients.
job_responsibilities: Support contract Logistics Services consisting of: Supply and Materials Management, Equipment Management, Property Disposal, Transportation Management (including shipping and fleet management), Mail Management

Perform duties found within the Performance Work Statement (PWS) Section 5, Equipment Management, Section 6, Property Disposal Management, and may support section 8, Mail Management in accordance with NASA Instructions and Technical Directives
Provide logistics support for the identification, control, and accountability of equipment acquired by NASA in accordance with NASA policy
Assist with Property Disposal Management and Reutilization of Excess and Surplus Property
Provide mail services (i.e., receipt, storage, and distribution) for the AFRC community
Utilize NASA provided computer equipment and software/databases to perform required job duties
Ensure a continuous audit trail of an item from its initial receipt by NASA until acceptance in DISPOSAL System
Develop methods and improve procedures for storing property, plan use of storage facilities
Expedite the flow of material, parts, and property in accordance with NASA priorities
Review supply and equipment requests for accuracy and assist in resolving all discrepancies
Create new catalog records using data provided
Assist in the performance of equipment account inventories as required
Process transfers and other transactions with supporting documentation
Process corrections/adjustments to equipment accounts, attaching the documents in the transaction records
Assist in the performance of Material Handling requirements
Sign for property received and ensure accountable property is cataloged according to NASA procedures
Assist in processing item turn-ins including processing turn-in transactions
Prepare property for shipment, arrange inspection from representatives, and move property to specified areas
Assist in the delivery of property received to the correct work center, or customer, and obtain signed receipt documentation
Assist with documentation and accountability over all vehicles assigned
Understand and work towards all timeliness and quality standards found in the Performance Requirements Summary for work area assigned
Compile report of quantity and type of work accomplished
Move or transport material from one department to another, using hand or industrial truck
May compile perpetual production records in order to locate material using manual or computerized system
Direct materiel management activities involved in developing, operating, implementing, and analyzing manual and automated integrated logistics systems
May be tasked, trained, and perform duties as a non-CDL Truck Driver or Material Handling Equipment operator
output_json.physical_requirements: Ability to safely lift to 50 lbs. Must be able to pass NASA forklift training and certification and pass NASA physical to receive forklift license. Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and via email. Ability to perform the physical requirements of the position including being on your feet most of the day and lifting requirements. Ability to be trained in the use of warehouse tools and manual material handling equipment.
benefits: Competitive base salary commensurate with qualifications and experience
